bug.author: vapaunic
bug.summary: Consider adding a Hyperdrive example notebook
bug.description: The hyperparameter tuning notebook currently uses a cv_utils parameter sweep module to explore hyperparameters. As far as I can tell, this runs an exhaustive search of the hyperparameter space (correct me if I'm wrong). It might be nice to include an example notebook on Hyperdrive, to showcase some of the nice features of Hyperdrive, such as early stopping, different sampling strategies, auto-scaling etc. This might be especially relevant to more complex / bigger network training, where one might not have enough resources to run an exhaustive parameter search.

comments.comment: Thank you, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vapaunic>@vapaunic</denchmark-link> , for your suggestion. Aashna (who is part of the AML team) is currently working on a HyperDrive notebook. So, this will be ultimately part of the repo.
